title: Exchange rates
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Economics - Study and teaching
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Australia - Economic policy
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/International economic relations
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Economics - Study and teaching
description: Episode of Series "Economics". Richard Bluck of Melbourne College of Advanced Education provides an overview of exchange rates. Highlights the background of the current 'floating of the dollar' showing alternatives and implications of the decision. Addresses fixed or floating exchange rates, definitions and mechanisms, problems of floating exchange rates, implications for public policy and management of the economy and the Australian experience.
